alert.note: Alert for Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 12:32AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following counties, Athens, Gallia, Jackson, Lawrence, Meigs, Morgan, Perry, Vinton and Washington. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1231 AM EST, high water and numerous road closures continue to be reported across southeast Ohio. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntington, Athens, Ashland, Marietta, Ironton, Jackson, Wellston, Nelsonville, New Lexington, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Glouster, McConnelsville, Mcarthur, Oak Hill, Somerset, Beverly and Rio Grande. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
